w:HTMLPanel.w:Heading: NavSpy
w:HTMLPanel.p: A NavSpy contains a link to registered Heading widgets, and listen to the scroll of the body or of a particular widget to display the curent active heading.
w:HTMLPanel.w:Heading: Basic usage
w:HTMLPanel.p: The Heading you want to display in the NavSpy have to be manualy registered with the navSpy property. After all registering you need to call the redraw method on the NavSpy in order to display it.
Use the scrollWidget property to set the targeting scroll widget. If no one is set, the the body element will be used.

w:HTMLPanel.w:Heading: Spy offset
w:HTMLPanel.p: Eventually you may want to apply an offset to the top of the scroll widget to spy the scroll or to navigate to the selected Heading. Use the spyOffset property.
We use this spy offset in this sample to take into account the navbar height when scrolling and spying scroll on the body
